perturbation.original_text:
10.3. Termination. Subject to Section 13.10  [Survival], upon termination of this
Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing
party or destroyed unless otherwise specified or permitted elsewhere under this
Agreement. The confidentiality obligations contained in this Article 10  [CONFIDENTIALITY] shall
survive termination of this Agreement for a period of three years.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.3. Termination. Subject to Section 13.10  [Survival], upon termination of this
Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing
party or destroyed unless otherwise specified or permitted elsewhere under this
Agreement. The confidentiality obligations contained in this Article 10  [CONFIDENTIALITY] shall
survive termination of this Agreement indefinitely.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that confidentiality obligations survive for three years after termination. The modified version changes this to "indefinitely," creating a contradiction about the duration of confidentiality obligations. It is now unclear how long this article lasts.

perturbation.original_text:
8.1. Automatic Renewal. This Agreement will automatically renew at the end
of the Initial Term or a subsequent renewal term on a year to year basis (each,
a "Renewal Term"), unless either party notifies the other at least 30 days prior
to the end of the Initial Term or then current Renewal Term, as applicable, of
its intention not to renew this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.1. Automatic Renewal. This Agreement will automatically renew at the end
of the Initial Term or a subsequent renewal term on a year to year basis (each,
a "Renewal Term"), unless both parties agree to renew this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Section 8.1 originally states the contract auto-renews unless one party objects. Changing it to require mutual agreement introduces contradiction; it is now unclear if it auto-renews or needs explicit agreement. This will cause uncertainty around contract renewal.

perturbation.original_text:
13.2. No Assignment. Except as otherwise set forth herein, neither party
shall transfer, assign or cede any rights or delegate any obligations hereunder,
in whole or in part, whether voluntarily or by operation of law, without the
prior written consent of the other party, which consent may be withheld at the
other party's reasonable business discretion; provided, however, that either
party may transfer this Agreement without prior written consent of the other
party to an Affiliate or in connection with a merger or sale of all or
substantially all of the stock or assets of such party.
perturbation.changed_text:
13.2. No Assignment. Except as otherwise set forth herein, neither party
shall transfer, assign or cede any rights or delegate any obligations hereunder,
in whole or in part, whether voluntarily or by operation of law, without the
prior written consent of the other party, which consent may be withheld at the
other party's reasonable business discretion; provided, however, that either party may freely assign this agreement to any entity.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states an entity needs permission to transfer, assign or cede rights of the contract to another entity but it's affiliate/merged entities are exempt. However, the changed text now states an entity can assign the agreement to any entity creating a contradiction.
